Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

If you only only want specific hosts, you can start your decide rules with =
a RejectDecideRule, so that nothing is accepted for crawling (including you=
r seed if you don't include any more rules), and then you use other rules t=
o start including specific hosts, patterns, etc.

   <!-- Begin by REJECTin=
g all... -->
    <bean class=3D"org.archive.modules.deciderules.RejectDecid=
eRule"></bean>

    <!--
           ...then ACCEPT those within configured/=
seed-implied SURT prefixes...
           Basically here you are ruling in a=
nything that starts with http://library.gc.cuny.edu.
           If you set =
alsoCheckVia to "true", you will also include one hop off of the included S=
URT prefix
           matching URLs, so if library.gc.cuny.edu<http://libra=
ry.gc.cuny.edu/> linked to http://cuny.edu/, that home page would be crawle=
d.
    -->
    <bean class=3D"org.archive.modules.deciderules.surt.SurtPref=
ixedDecideRule">
          <property name=3D"seedsAsSurtPrefixes" value=3D"=
false" />
          <property name=3D"alsoCheckVia" value=3D"false" />
    =
      <property name=3D"surtsSourceFile" value=3D"" />
          <property =
name=3D"surtsDumpFile" value=3D"${launchId}/surts.dump" />
          <prope=
rty name=3D"surtsSource">
           <bean class=3D"org.archive.spring.Conf=
igString">
            <property name=3D"value">
             <value>
     =
         # you can supply these values using SURT form
              +http:=
//(edu,cuny,gc,library,
              # or not SURT form
              http=
s://library.gc.cuny.edu
             </value>
            </property>
     =
      </bean>
          </property>
    </bean>

    <!--
         This rul=
e says only to go so many hops from your seed,
         so if you don't wan=
t to go more than 20 clicks past https://library.gc.cuny.edu use this
    -=
->
    <bean id=3D"scopeMaxHops" class=3D"org.archive.modules.deciderules.T=
ooManyHopsDecideRule">
          <property name=3D"maxHops" value=3D"20" />=

    </bean>

    <!--
           ACCEPT those from a configurable set of U=
RI regexes...
           You can include URIs with a regular expression; ma=
ybe you want a small part of gc.unt.edu.
    -->
    <bean class=3D"org.arc=
hive.modules.deciderules.MatchesListRegexDecideRule">
          <property n=
ame=3D"decision" value=3D"ACCEPT"/>
     <!-- <property name=3D"listLogical=
Or" value=3D"true" /> -->
          <property name=3D"regexList">
         =
  <list>
            <value>^https?://(www\.)?gc\.cuny\.edu/[^/]+/docs/.*$<=
/value>
           </list>
          </property>
    </bean>

    <!--
    =
      ...and REJECT those from a configurable set of URI regexes...
       =
   You can also exclude parts of library.gc.cuny.edu<https://library.gc.cun=
y.edu> with a regular expression
    -->
    <bean class=3D"org.archive.mod=
ules.deciderules.MatchesListRegexDecideRule">
          <property name=3D"d=
ecision" value=3D"REJECT"/>
     <!-- <property name=3D"listLogicalOr" valu=
e=3D"true" /> -->
          <property name=3D"regexList">
           <list>=

            <value>^https?://(www\.)?library\.gc\.cuny\.edu/crawler-trap/p=
ath.*$</value>
           </list>
          </property>
    </bean>

    <!=
-- ...You can also REJECT those from a configurable set of REJECT SURTs... =
-->
    <bean class=3D"org.archive.modules.deciderules.surt.SurtPrefixedDec=
ideRule">
          <property name=3D"decision" value=3D"REJECT"/>
        =
  <property name=3D"seedsAsSurtPrefixes" value=3D"false"/>
          <prope=
rty name=3D"surtsDumpFile" value=3D"${launchId}/negative-surts.dump" />
   =
       <property name=3D"surtsSource">
           <bean class=3D"org.archiv=
e.spring.ConfigString">
            <property name=3D"value">
             =
<value>
              http://wordpress.org
             </value>
          =
  </property>
           </bean>
          </property>
    </bean>

    <!-=
-
          ...but ACCEPT those where path-from-seed ends in at least one n=
on-navlink hop...
          This allows including embedded images, js, css,=
 etc. needed to render a scoped in page,
          even if the host is not =
l<https://library.gc.cuny.edu/>ibrary.gc.unt.edu.
    -->
    <bean class=
=3D"org.archive.modules.deciderules.TransclusionDecideRule">
          <pro=
perty name=3D"maxTransHops" value=3D"2" />
          <property name=3D"maxS=
peculativeHops" value=3D"1" />
    </bean>


If you instead want to configu=
re a crawl accept any URL no matter what the host etc., you can start with =
an AcceptDecideRule and limit how much is crawled with a TooManyHopsDecideR=
ule.

  <!-- Begin by ACCEPTing all... -->
    <bean class=3D"org.archive.m=
odules.deciderules.AcceptDecideRule"></bean>

  <!-- Crawl two hops (naviga=
tion links) away from the seed... -->
    <bean id=3D"scopeMaxHops" class=
=3D"org.archive.modules.deciderules.TooManyHopsDecideRule">
          <prop=
erty name=3D"maxHops" value=3D"2" />
    </bean>


Order of rules is import=
ant. Each rule decides if a URL should get an ACCEPT, REJECT, or should sta=
y unchanged from what the previous rule decided. At the end of the set of r=
ules, if the URI has an ACCEPT, it is crawled.

This previous thread with a=
n attached sample scope rule set might also help as an example:
https://gro=
ups.yahoo.com/neo/groups/archive-crawler/conversations/topics/8854

You can=
 look up each rule's meaning here: https://github.com/internetarchive/herit=
rix3/wiki/Configuring%20Crawl%20Scope%20Using%20DecideRules

Lauren Ko
Digi=
tal Libraries Division
UNT Libraries

--_000_DM5PR01MB2506FD065A98DB1C05BFAFC5E47B0DM5PR01MB2506prod_

<div>If you only only want specif=

<div>    <bean c=
lass=3D"org.archive.modules.deciderules.RejectDecideRule"><spa=
n style=3D"font-size:12pt"></bean></span></div>
<div><span style=3D"f=

http://library.gc.cuny.edu</a>.</div>

;">library.gc.cuny.edu</a> linked
 to http://cuny.edu/, that home&nbsp=

</div>
<div>If you instead want to configure a crawl accept an=
y URL no matter what the host etc., you can start with an AcceptDecideRule =
and limit how much is crawled with a <span>TooManyHopsDecideRule</span=
>.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div>
<div style=3D"font-family: Calibri, Helveti=
ca, sans-serif, EmojiFont, "Apple Color Emoji", "Segoe UI Em=
oji", NotoColorEmoji, "Segoe UI Symbol", "Android Emoji=
", EmojiSymbols; font-size: 16px;">
  <!-- Begin by ACCEP=
Ting all... --></div>
<div style=3D"font-family: Calibri, Helvetica, san=
s-serif, EmojiFont, "Apple Color Emoji", "Segoe UI Emoji&quo=
t;, NotoColorEmoji, "Segoe UI Symbol", "Android Emoji",=
 EmojiSymbols; font-size: 16px;">
    <bean class=3D"org.=
archive.modules.deciderules.<span style=3D"color: rgb(36, 41, 46); font-fam=
ily: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, "Segoe UI", Helvetica, Ar=
ial, sans-serif, "Apple Color Emoji", "Segoe UI Emoji",=
 "Segoe UI Symbol"; font-size: 16px;">AcceptDecideRule</span>&quo=
t;><span style=3D"font-size: 12pt;"></bean></span></div>
<br>
</di=
v>
<div><span style=3D"font-family: Calibri, Helvetica, sans-serif, EmojiFo=
nt, "Apple Color Emoji", "Segoe UI Emoji", NotoColorEmo=
ji, "Segoe UI Symbol", "Android Emoji", EmojiSymbols; f=
ont-size: 16px;">  <!-- Crawl two hops (navigation links) away from=
 the seed</span><span style=3D"font-family: Calibri, Helvetica, sans-serif,=
 EmojiFont, "Apple Color Emoji", "Segoe UI Emoji", Noto=
ColorEmoji, "Segoe UI Symbol", "Android Emoji", EmojiSy=
mbols; font-size: 16px;">...
 --></span><br>
</div>
<div>
<div style=3D"=
font-family: Calibri, Helvetica, sans-serif, EmojiFont, "Apple Color E=
moji", "Segoe UI Emoji", NotoColorEmoji, "Segoe UI Symb=
ol", "Android Emoji", EmojiSymbols; font-size: 16px;">

;   <bean id=3D"scopeMaxHops" class=3D"org.archive.m=

quot;2" /></div>
<div style=3D"font-family: Calibri, Helvetica, san=
s-serif, EmojiFont, "Apple Color Emoji", "Segoe UI Emoji&quo=
t;, NotoColorEmoji, "Segoe UI Symbol", "Android Emoji",=
 EmojiSymbols; font-size: 16px;">
    </bean></div>
<br>
</=
div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div><span style=3D"font-family: Calibri, Helvetica, =
sans-serif, EmojiFont, "Apple Color Emoji", "Segoe UI Emoji&=
quot;, NotoColorEmoji, "Segoe UI Symbol", "Android Emoji&quo=
t;, EmojiSymbols; font-size: 16px;">Order of rules is important. Each rule =
decides if a URL should
 get an ACCEPT, REJECT, </span><span style=3D"=
font-family: Calibri, Helvetica, sans-serif, EmojiFont, "Apple Color E=
moji", "Segoe UI Emoji", NotoColorEmoji, "Segoe UI Symb=
ol", "Android Emoji", EmojiSymbols; font-size: 16px;">or sho=
uld stay unchanged from what
 the previous rule decided</span><span style=
=3D"font-family: Calibri, Helvetica, sans-serif, EmojiFont, "Apple Col=
or Emoji", "Segoe UI Emoji", NotoColorEmoji, "Segoe UI =
Symbol", "Android Emoji", EmojiSymbols; font-size: 16px;">. =
At the end of the set of rules,
 if the URI has an ACCEPT, it is crawled.</=
span><br>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div><span style=3D"font-family:Calibri,H=
elvetica,sans-serif,EmojiFont,"Apple Color Emoji","Segoe UI =
Emoji",NotoColorEmoji,"Segoe UI Symbol","Android Emoji&=
quot;,EmojiSymbols; font-size:16px">This previous </span><span style=
=3D"font-family:Calibri,Helvetica,sans-serif,EmojiFont,"Apple Color Em=
oji","Segoe UI Emoji",NotoColorEmoji,"Segoe UI Symbol&q=

quot;Apple Color Emoji","Segoe UI Emoji",NotoColorEmoji,&quo=

-family:Calibri,Helvetica,sans-serif,EmojiFont,"Apple Color Emoji&quot=
;,"Segoe UI Emoji",NotoColorEmoji,"Segoe UI Symbol",&qu=
ot;Android Emoji",EmojiSymbols; font-size:16px" previewremoved=3D"true=
">https://groups.yahoo.com/neo/groups/archive-crawler/conversations/topics/=
8854</a><br>

</div>
